titles.title: To require certain warning labels to be placed on video games that are given certain ratings due to violent content.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.

committee.name: House Committee on Energy and Commerce

action.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Commerce, Manufacturing, and Trade.

bill.summary: 1/24/2011--Introduced. Requires the Consumer Product Safety Commission (CPSC) to issue regulations requiring that a specified warning label be placed on the packaging of any video game that is rated T (Teen) or higher by the Electronics Software Ratings Board.
